text: Clube Atlético Aliança, commonly known as Aliança, is a Brazilian football club based in Santana, Amapá state. ==History== The club was founded on November 15, 1995. Aliança won the Campeonato Amapaense in 1998, and finished as runners-up in 1999, losing the competition to Ypiranga. ==Achievements== * Campeonato Amapaense: ** Winners (1): 1998 ==Stadium== Clube Atlético Aliança play their home games at Estádio Antônio Villela, nicknamed Vilelão. The stadium has a maximum capacity of 3,000 people. ==References== Category:Football clubs in Amapá Category:Association football clubs established in 1973 Category:1973 establishments in Brazil
title: Clube Atlético Aliança
